name: 6LACK
description:
'''Ricardo Valdez Valentine Jr.''' (born June 24, 1992), known professionally as '''6lack''' (stylized as '''6LACK''', pronounced "black"), is an American [[Contemporary R&B|R&B]] singer and songwriter. Born in [[Baltimore, Maryland]] and raised in [[Atlanta, Georgia]], he gained recognition following the release of his 2016 single "[[Prblms]]", which marked his first entry on the [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]]. He signed with [[Love Renaissance]], an imprint of Interscope Records to release his debut studio album, ''[[Free 6lack]]'' (2016), which was nominated for [[Best Urban Contemporary Album]] at the [[60th Annual Grammy Awards]] and received [[RIAA certification|platinum]] certification by the [[Recording Industry Association of America]] (RIAA).

Two years later, he released his second studio album ''[[East Atlanta Love Letter]]'' (2018), which peaked at number three on the [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]]. That same year, he released the single "[[OTW (Khalid, Ty Dolla Sign and 6lack song)|OTW]]" (with [[Khalid (American singer)|Khalid]] and [[Ty Dolla Sign]]) and guest featured on [[Normani]]'s single "[[Waves (Normani song)|Waves]]"—which earned an [[MTV Video Music Awards|MTV Video Music Award]]. In June 2020, he released his debut extended play (EP) ''[[6pc Hot EP|6pc Hot]]'', which included the single "[[Know My Rights]]" (featuring [[Lil Baby]]). Later that year, he guest performed alongside [[Elton John]] on [[Gorillaz]]'s single "[[The Pink Phantom]]". His 2021 single, "[[Calling My Phone]]" (featuring [[Lil Tjay]]) peaked at number three on the ''Billboard'' Hot 100 and peaked atop the [[Canadian Hot 100]]; it remains his highest-charting song on the former chart. His third album, ''[[Since I Have a Lover]]'' (2023) was met with moderate critical and commercial reception.

6lack joined the Atlanta-Baltimore musical collective [[Spillage Village]]—founded by [[EarthGang]] and [[JID]]—in 2014. He has received three [[Grammy Award]] nominations.
